quote_first: Breakfast over, my uncle drew from his pocket a small notebook, intended for scientific observations. He consulted his instruments, and recorded: “Monday, July 1. “Chronometer,
quote_last: ; barometer, 297 in.; thermometer, 6° (43° F.). Direction, E.S.E.” This last observation applied to the dark gallery, and was indicated by the compass.
title: A Journey to the Centre of the Earth
author: Jules Verne

quote_first:
Breakfast over, my uncle drew from his pocket a small notebook, intended for scientific observations. He consulted his instruments, and recorded:
“Monday, July 1.
“Chronometer,
quote_last:
; barometer, 297 in.; thermometer, 6° (43° F.). Direction, E.S.E.”
This last observation applied to the dark gallery, and was indicated by the compass.
title: A Journey to the Centre of the Earth
author: Jules Verne
